'import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Convert Power BI dataset to pandas DataFrame
df = pd.DataFrame(dataset)

# Convert FIN_OPEN_DT to datetime (ignore invalid entries)
df[''FIN_OPEN_DT''] = pd.to_datetime(df[''FIN_OPEN_DT''], errors=''coerce'')

# Drop missing dates
df = df.dropna(subset=[''FIN_OPEN_DT''])

# Extract year from FIN_OPEN_DT
df[''OPEN_YEAR''] = df[''FIN_OPEN_DT''].dt.year

# Group by year and count stores opened
store_open_trend = (
    df.groupby(''OPEN_YEAR'')[''STORE_NBR'']
      .nunique()
      .reset_index(name=''STORE_COUNT'')
      .sort_values(''OPEN_YEAR'')
)

# Compute cumulative store openings
store_open_trend[''CUMULATIVE_STORES''] = np.cumsum(store_open_trend[''STORE_COUNT''])

# --- Create line chart ---
plt.figure(figsize=(8, 4))
plt.plot(
    store_open_trend[''OPEN_YEAR''],
    store_open_trend[''CUMULATIVE_STORES''],
    marker=''o'',
    color=''#0078d4'',
    linewidth=2
)

plt.title(''Cumulative Store Openings by Year â€“ WM Luminate'', fontsize=12, weight=''bold'')
plt.xlabel(''Opening Year'')
plt.ylabel(''Cumulative Store Count'')
plt.grid(True, linestyle=''--'', alpha=0.6)
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()
'
